SEARCH

Class Solution

java.lang.Object
Solution
public class Solution extends Object
Represents a solution to a problem using a greedy algorithm to assign projects to students. The algorithm prioritizes assigning uniquely preferred projects first, then assigns remaining projects based on student preferences and availability.

This solution ensures that each student is assigned to exactly one project, and each project is assigned to at most one student.

  • Constructor Details

    • Solution

      public Solution(int SolutionID, String SolutionDescription, Problem problem)
      Constructs a solution for a problem using the greedy assignment algorithm.
      Parameters:
      SolutionID - the unique identifier for this solution
      SolutionDescription - a textual description of the solution approach
      problem - the problem to solve (contains students, teachers, and projects)
      See Also:
      • Initializes project assignments immediately

  • Method Details

    • getSolutionID

      public int getSolutionID()
      Gets the solution's unique identifier.
      Returns:
      the solution ID

    • getSolutionDescription

      public String getSolutionDescription()
      Gets the description of the solution strategy.
      Returns:
      the solution description text

    • runGreedy

      private void runGreedy(Problem problem)
      Executes the greedy assignment algorithm which consists of two passes:
      1. First pass: Assigns projects that are uniquely preferred by one student.
      2. Second pass: Assigns remaining projects to students based on their preferences, or any available project if preferred ones are taken.
      Parameters:
      problem - the problem containing the students, teachers, and projects to process
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a student cannot be assigned a project due to no available projects

    • countProjectPreferences

      private int countProjectPreferences(Student[] students, int projectId)
      Counts the number of students who have a specific project as one of their preferences.
      Parameters:
      students - the array of students to check
      projectId - the ID of the project to count preferences for
      Returns:
      the total number of students who prefer the specified project

    • findProjectById

      private Project findProjectById(int id, Project[] projects)
      Finds a project by its ID within an array of projects.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the project to find
      projects - the array of projects to search
      Returns:
      the project with the matching ID
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no project with the given ID exists in the array

    • assignProjectToStudent

      private void assignProjectToStudent(Student student, Project project)
      Assigns a project to a student by setting the project's ID as the student's assigned project.
      Parameters:
      student - the student to assign the project to
      project - the project to be assigned

    • extractStudents

      private Student[] extractStudents(Person[] allPersons)
      Extracts students from an array containing both students and teachers.
      Parameters:
      allPersons - array containing both students and non-student persons (e.g., teachers)
      Returns:
      array of students with no null entries

    • getAssignedStudents

      public Student[] getAssignedStudents()

    • getAssignedProjects

      public Project[] getAssignedProjects()
      Gets the projects assigned to students. The order matches the student array from getAssignedStudents().
